alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 9:19PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western McIntosh, northwestern Pittsburg, Okmulgee and eastern Okfuskee Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 919 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Okemah to Wetumka to near Atwood. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Indianola... Grayson... Hanna... Hoffman... Clearview... Stidham... Preston... Raiford... Vivian... Pharoah... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 217 and 255. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
